about.heading: WELCOME TO MY CREATIVE SPACE!
about.description:
Hi there ğŸ˜Š If you're here, it's because I wanted to share this little piece of my soul with you.

In this space you'll find personal writings from different moments in my life â€” some poetic, others just honest thoughts. You can also listen to my own music, which Iâ€™ve uploaded to the player in the highest quality possible. And if youâ€™d like to save them for later, the YouTube videos are available on the mini TVs below.

This place was born as a refuge and a collection to gather some of my creations that are once scattered across my world. Now, finally gathered in one place, it allows me to express myself, reflect, and share my creativity and artistic side with anyone who feels a connection.

Thank you for being here. I hope that something you see or hear resonates with you too.

Voting is still open, so if you enjoyed anything, feel free to leave your stars! â­

artworks.texto:
Where things donâ€™t happen, time holds the weight of oddities and other strange loads...
escapism of a world dreaming to wake up, stuffing its holes with cork as it tries.

Yesterday, today and tomorrow glare at me while I live in this amnesia that nothing can anesthetize.
And even though we know everything descends, we still love to climb stairs and twist them until they become impossible,
until the fall becomes tangible...
Something visible since the dawn of time, living in our knowledge â€” yet we deny it in vain, and pay for it later, of course.

As for plain and silly things, they donâ€™t offend â€” theyâ€™re easy to taste, and leave the mind distressed.
But this complication, this everything in the process of formation... is something that never perishes, something all deserve, though few practice it.
Something paid for dearly...

But sadly, nowadays we bet on plastic faces rather than practical minds,
trying to make aesthetics static amidst all this cataclysm.

After a long time lost, this ship longs to sail again.
Even with a few cracked planks, it could face the darkest sea...

Itâ€™s not that this ship has changed â€”
itâ€™s already sailed through cold rivers...
itâ€™s the one steering the helm
who now holds the awareness of all thatâ€™s been crossed.

Fuck it.

Iâ€™m free in my mental prison, flying...

I see their souls through their eyes â€” most are rotten, nonexistent...
The brightest ones...

Iâ€™m sure you can hear their hearts cry.

I come from darkness, looking for some light â€”
almost always absent.

What can you give? What are you willing to receive?

Big hearts ache in lonely souls, they often break but will try again.
Until chaos covers it all... giving up is dying.

M Â· ost beautiful things
A Â· re not always possible.
N Â· o, ainâ€™t pain â€” these tears are love.
D Â· ifferent things for us will come.
Y Â· ou deserve best, always will be loved. ğŸ’”

In her ashes, you could still read what the fire of passion consumed...

While the flames of misunderstanding burned the rest.

I could rewrite it, so as not to lose it.
I could let the wind blow it away...

Even if I fester, I will keep wielding my sword from the heart.
Even after a thousand lost battles, Iâ€™ll keep looking forward â€” for the war that never ends is the one born within.

Donâ€™t search through ruins for the greatness you already carry,
even if you canâ€™t see it, even if they hurt you, even if walking becomes hard...
No matter the pain, donâ€™t settle for less, donâ€™t pity yourself.

Keep fighting for something as valuable as who you already are,
for those who once fought,
for those still walking and fighting beside you,
for you, at your side.

I take the elevator to the eighth floor.
Then I climb one more flight of stairs.
After that, I cross the last door and reach the rooftop: my home.
Thatâ€™s where I live. Thatâ€™s where I create.

From above, songs seem to speak about me.
Of walls full of notes, of locked doors,
of hopes that are born each morning.

Here I design. Here I compose.
Here I breathe my own freedom.

I live on the rooftop.
Where days begin and shadows stretch.
Where the sky brushes my thoughts and the city whispers below.

Here I have everything that matters: my art, my freedom, and a place to sit and breathe with the sun on my face.

I am rich. Because I have my space, my vision,
and a whole universe to observe and transform from up here.

My dreams werenâ€™t broken â€” just stored away, hidden.
They shrank under the pressure of the world around me...
So small they seemed invisible, useless, even arrogant.

So I tucked them in the drawer of oblivion, next to the vinyl that recorded these verses.
But when I opened it again, they had grown â€” and flipped to the B side.

I dusted them off, and as the vinyl began to play... they did the rest.

I see it, I try it, I feel it, I think it.
I sense it, believe it, ruin it, compose it...

Gently I try, but I break, then rebuild.
I fill up, empty out, and stare into weariness...

It excites me, impresses me, disappoints me, shocks me.
Kicks me down, then offers a rose â€” and thatâ€™s no small thing...

That life can be so cruel... and yet so beautiful.
